alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 2:01AM PST until December 06 at 7:41AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. North Fork Stillaguamish River Near Arlington affecting Snohomish County. .Heavy rain will continue in the North Central Washington Cascades through this afternoon. Another 2 to 4 inches of rain is forecast before the rate rates ease late in the day. The 12 rainfall totals ending at 1 Am were in the 1.5 to near 4 inch range. For the North West Region...including Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillaguamish River at Arlington. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the Stillaguamish River will cause minor flooding mainly in the Silvana area...including over Pioneer Highway and along Norman Rd. A stage of 16 feet on the Stillaguamish River corresponds roughly to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood program. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:20 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 16.1 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1015 AM PST.
